text: The 1983–84 season was the 87th season of competitive football in Scotland. ==Scottish Premier Division== Champions: Aberdeen Relegated: St. Johnstone, Motherwell ==Scottish League Division One== Promoted: Morton, Dumbarton Relegated: Raith Rovers, Alloa Athletic ==Scottish League Division Two== Promoted: Forfar Athletic, East Fife ==Other honours== ===Cup honours=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=140|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up !Report |- |align=left|Scottish Cup 1983–84 |Aberdeen |2 – 1 |Celtic |Wikipedia article |- |align=left|League Cup 1983–84 |Rangers |3 – 2 |Celtic |Wikipedia article |- |align=left|Youth Cup |Celtic |2 – 0 |Rangers |- |align=left|Junior Cup |Bo'ness United |2 – 0 |Baillieston Juniors |} ===Individual honours=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=170|Award ! width=150|Winner ! width=140|Club |- | Footballer of the Year || Willie Miller || Aberdeen |- |Players' Player of the Year || Willie Miller || Aberdeen |- |Young Player of the Year || John Robertson || Heart of Midlothian |} ==Scottish national team== {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! !Competition !Scotland scorer(s) |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |21 September 1983 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | Uruguay |align=center|2–0 |Friendly |John Robertson, Davie Dodds |-bgcolor=#ffffdd |12 October 1983 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | Belgium |align=center|1–1 |ECQG1 |Charlie Nicholas |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |16 November 1983 |Kurt-Wabbel Stadion, Halle (A) | East Germany |align=center|1–2 |ECQG1 |Eamonn Bannon |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |13 December 1983 |Windsor Park, Belfast (A) | Northern Ireland |align=center|0–2 |BHC | |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |28 February 1984 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | Wales |align=center|2–1 |BHC |Davie Cooper, Maurice Johnston |-bgcolor=#ffffdd |26 May 1984 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | England |align=center|1–1 |BHC |Mark McGhee |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |1 June 1984 |Stade Vélodrome, Marseilles (A) | France |align=center|0–2 |Friendly | |} Key: *(H) = Home match *(A) = Away match *ECQG1 = European Championship qualifying - Group 1 *BHC = British Home Championship ==See also== 1983–84 Aberdeen F.C. season ==Notes and references== Category:Seasons in Scottish football
title: 1983–84 in Scottish football
